job_description: Database Reliability Engineer (Junior or Intermediate or Senior) - Hybrid - job post Teacher Retirement System of Texas 29 reviews Austin, TX 78701 $60,845 - $122,489 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $60,845 - $122,489 a year Job Type Full-time WHO WE ARE: The Information Technology (IT) Division lays the foundation for TRS to deliver excellent service experiences across the organization and with our members. We serve with purpose through mentorship and collaboration across a diverse team unified by innovation to create technology and information solutions that have a positive impact on our members’ lives. We invite you to join one of Austin’s Top Workplaces. TRS offers a best-in-class combination of technology and continuous learning opportunities to equip you to solve problems, expand your knowledge, and create impact for 1 in 20 Texans. Position Summary The Database Reliability Engineer performs database development, migration, and administration work. Work involves using source control, continuous integration and delivery, and configuration management tools to setup and maintain database infrastructure; assisting with long-range database planning; and embedding with development teams to build and deploy database change during project release cycles. The position is posted at 3 levels: Database Reliability Engineer Associate(Junior), Database Reliability Engineer(intermediate), Senior Database Reliability Engineer(Senior). Selected applicants will be placed in the classification that most closely aligns with their education and experience level. WHAT WILL YOU DO: Job Description Database Development Designs and maintains database structures and coordinates and supports the installation, design, development, maintenance, and monitoring of integrated database systems. Provides technical assistance to other teams and assists them in analyzing and resolving problems. Designs and implements procedures necessary to save and recover databases from hardware and software failures. Utilizes source control, continuous integration and delivery, and configuration management processes and tools to automate and verify consistency of database work. Database Planning Plans, organizes, coordinates, and/or participates in special projects. Consults with other teams and determines database tasks necessary to support project initiatives. Assesses future information requirements to develop long-range, comprehensive database plans. Research developments in the database and software reliability engineering fields and recommends processes and tools for continuous improvement. Assists in developing goals, objectives, and cost estimates for the development and use of efficient and cost-effective database systems for agency users. Database Environments Assists in developing policies and procedures designed to ensure the integrity of the database environment and in developing standards for database security. Creates database environments for applications including the creation of necessary libraries and procedures. Evaluates requests for new data elements and systems and incorporates into the existing shared data environment. Performs or reviews data modeling. Monitors the operational database environment and takes corrective measures to ensure efficient performance. Performs other related work as assigned, including on-call or scheduled after-hours work. WHAT WILL YOU BRING: Required Education Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university. High school diploma or equivalent and additional full-time work experience in information systems, computer operations, programming, database development, or a related technically oriented field may substitute for the required education on an equivalent year for year basis. Required Experience (Database Reliability Engineer Associate) One (1) year experience in developing, maintaining, and using automated processes and tools to provide reliable database infrastructure. Required Experience (Database Reliability Engineer) Four (4) years of experience in Microsoft SQL Server database development and administration. Proven ability to develop, maintain, and use automated processes and tools to provide reliable database infrastructure. Required Experience (Senior Database Reliability Engineer) Six (6) years of experience in Microsoft SQL Server database development and administration. One (1) year of experience in project leadership. Proven ability to develop, maintain, and use automated processes and tools to provide reliable database infrastructure. Experience can be concurrent. Required Registration, Certification, or Licensure None. Preferred qualification Two (2) years of experience in Microsoft SQL Server database development and administration. (only for Database Reliability Associate) Working knowledge of source control and continuous integration processes and tools to build and deploy database change. Working knowledge of configuration management process and tools to setup and maintain database infrastructure. Working knowledge of Office 365. Experience collaborating with business, development, and operational teams to support Agile project delivery. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Knowledge of: Relational database concepts, T-SQL, current database technologies and data analysis techniques. Microsoft SQL Server database software including experience in DML, DDL and patching SQL Server and Microsoft operating systems. The principles, practices, and techniques of computer programming and systems analysis and design. Skill in: Planning, organizing, and coordinating work to effectively meet frequent and/or multiple deadlines; handling multiple tasks simultaneously; and managing conflicting priorities and demands. Analyzing problems and devising effective solutions. Communicating complex technical information to people of varying technical backgrounds. Using a computer in a Windows environment with word processing, spreadsheet, and other business software. Ability to: Establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with co-workers, agency staff, and external contacts. Work effectively in a professional team environment. Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) Codes: Veterans, Reservists or Guardsmen with experience in the Military Occupational Specialty ( http://www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_AdministrativeSupport.pdf ) along with the minimum qualifications listed above may meet the minimum requirements and are highly encouraged to apply. Please contact Talent Acquisition at careers@trs.texas.gov with questions or for additional information. To view all job vacancies, visit www.trs.texas.gov/careers or www.trs.csod.com/careersite. For more information, visit www.trs.texas.gov.

Principal Cloud Engineer (AWS) - job post Wood Mackenzie 48 reviews Austin, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Company Description Wood Mackenzie are the global research, analytics, and consultancy business powering the natural resources industry. For 50 years, we have been providing the quality data, analytics, and insights our customers rely on to inspire their decision making. Our dedicated oil, gas & LNG, power & renewables, chemicals, metals & mining sector teams are located around the world and deliver a variety of projects based on our assessment and valuation of thousands of individual assets, companies, and economic indicators such as market supply, demand, and price trends. We have over 1,900 employees in 30 locations, serving customers in nearly 80 countries. Together, we inspire and innovate the markets we serve – providing invaluable intelligence to help our customers overcome the toughest challenges, and make strategic decisions that will, ultimately, accelerate the world’s transition to a more sustainable future. Job Description Wood Mackenzie has an exciting opportunity for a Principal SRE focused on AWS Cloud to join a dynamic global business to help drive change and innovation. We’re looking for a skilled DevOps professional to help us setup a new Wood Mackenzie AWS cloud infrastructure. This includes many accounts, transit gateways, governance, and compliance to be managed as part of this process. We are transitioning as part of a divestiture; we need an experienced person to provide guidance on this process and insight for the future. Role Purpose The principal responsibility of this role is to provide operational expertise within the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team and work with the Cloud Ops team to design, manage, and maintain the AWS cloud ecosystem within Wood Mackenzie. This role will work in conjunction with the software engineering teams for releasing and maintaining new and existing applications. This encompasses: Manage the AWS cloud environment to perform efficiently, effectively, and securely through automation and governance best practices. Work in partnership with the business and the technology teams, bringing awareness and insight into the different operational constraints / opportunities for projects targeting cloud-based or on-premises deployment. As a principal member of the team, acts as a mentor for the group, provides guidance around design and approach, constructively challenges service design and implementations, exhibits a high degree of autonomy in making decisions over competing priorities, and proposes new solutions and tools to innovate and improve. Promotion of mutual feedback in cross-functional groups, following SRE best practices within a DevOps culture. A strong focus on service availability and proactive detection of problems. Ability to articulate technical and business concepts to different audiences and be able to influence technical decisions with solid metrics collection and proof of concepts Responsibilities: Work with cross-functional teams to design and support delivery pipelines for projects living in cloud-based and on-premises environments. Provide added value to cross-functional teams by raising awareness of operational constraints and opportunities (i.e., auto-scaling, containerization). Ensure full coverage of the live environments from a monitoring, performance, and availability perspective, continuously identifying areas of improvement Actively participate in team research & development to bring consistency and improve ease of access and maintenance for our tooling. Work with a continuous improvement and forward-thinking mindset, identifying operational processes that could be improved and drafting proposals. As a Senior member of the team, acts as a mentor for the group, constructively challenges service design and implementations, exhibits a high degree of autonomy in making a decision over competing priorities, and proposes new roadmap items to innovate and improve. Qualifications We understand every organization is different and professionals have their own unique history and experience, so we don’t expect to find a 100% match of candidate competencies regarding the tech stack in use at Wood Mackenzie. We list our preferred technologies, but if you have transferrable knowledge and are willing to learn what you do not know, we will consider your application. Skill Requirements: 10 years experience with SRE/DevOps 5+ years experience with AWS cloud design and management, managing multiple accounts, Control Tower, SCPs, Policies, VPCs, etc. BS degree in IT/IS/CS or additional equivalent work experience. Have worked in an Agile environment supporting multiple software engineering teams for product releases, database and table creation, and monitoring/insight into issues. A DevOps mindset; experience in agile processes (Kanban / Scrum) is important, and familiarity with Atlassian JIRA is very welcome. Experience with Infrastructure as Code (CloudFormation/Terraform) and a focus on automation. Work independently as part of a cross-functional, global team. Assist with routine system maintenance. Participate in an on-call support rotation every few weeks. Additional Information Wood Mackenzie is an equal opportunities employer. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran’s status, age or disability. https://www.woodmac.com/careers/jobs/ Unsolicited resumes sent to Wood Mackenzie, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Wood Mackenzie business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Wood Mackenzie employees, will be considered Wood Mackenzie property. Wood Mackenzie will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice

Debug process integration issues to ensure interactions between processes are kept under control Build process documentation to accurately define the process to cross-functional teams (equipment, quality, production, etc.) Model holistic process costs using bottoms-up system approach What You’ll Bring · Either a BS with 6+ years’ relevant experience or an MS with 3+ years relevant experience in interdisciplinary/integrated engineering, process development, manufacturing engineering, or equivalent. Senior roles available for more experienced candidates Strong understanding of engineering fundamentals and ability to apply them towards manufacturing process development Proven problem solver - demonstrated experience of data driven root cause analysis, statistical software (JMP) a plus · Demonstrated capabilities in manufacturing process development for new and unique products Experience in high volume manufacturing involving one or more of these areas is highly desired: Roll to roll coating processes Continuous wet deposition processes Dry powder handling and processing Automated mechanical assembly Power electronics Industrial chemical processing Battery manufacturing (li-ion or other chemistry) Industrial laser processing Long-term reliability testing

Senior Manufacturing Engineer - job post Unimacts Austin, TX • Remote From $80,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary From $80,000 a year Job Type Full-time Unimacts Global, LLC Job Posting: Sr. Manufacturing Engineer – Austin TX POSITION: Senior Manufacturing Engineer LOCATION: USA - Austin TX preferred TYPE: Full-Time COMPANY OVERVIEW www.unimacts.com Unimacts (UNX) is a leader in the Industrial Manufacturing Services space. UNX offers contract manufacturing and supply chain management services to industrial OEMs globally with a focus on the alternative energy sectors of solar and wind. UNX provides castings, forgings, fabrications, assemblies, and machine shop services, as well as complimentary quality, supply chain, and engineering services. UNX provides these solutions from its own factories in the USA, Mexico, and Spain, logistics / operations centers in USA and Europe, and from partner supply factories around the world. POSITION DESCRIPTION Unimacts is seeking a Senior Manufacturing Engineer (ME) to support our continued growth in global operations, whilst our employees are “industrial business athletes” and can be effective in many roles, the key responsibility of this person is to lead and where needed take a “hands on” role in the development of our manufacturing operations capabilities. This position will report directly to the VP of operations and whilst the role will have a global aspect to its scope it will initially be involved in the development of our Tijuana Mexico plant producing high volume electro-mechanical assemblies. The successful candidate will be expected to work directly with customers, suppliers and as part of multi-functional teams across the Global Unimacts network. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES Lead and action process development programs on our existing manufacturing equipment to improve our performance metrics. Manage capital investment projects, for new products / processes and expansion of current capabilities. Lead kaizen events, improvement workshops and team-based programs to improve performance. Lead new product programs using APQP processes and the Unimacts Operating System (UOS) disciplines and controls, leading Design for Manufacture (DFM) and Lean 6 sigma-based thinking in process design. Support PPAP based introduction of new product programs, create work instructions and required process control documentation. Work with customers and suppliers on the implementation of automated and robotic assembly systems. Experience in the manufacture of electric motors or similar electrical assemblies to UL standards would be a benefit. Implement engineering change and associated process change. Calculate cost estimates for new product and process introduction. Be a leader of metrics driven continuous improvement. Strong leader of our Safety – Quality – Delivery – Cost based operational excellence culture. Creating drawings and/or schematics enabling communication and/or design of equipment. Coordinate equipment installation and start-up. QUALIFICATIONS Detail oriented, hands-on, self-starter, enjoys leading projects and ad-hoc global teams. Lean 6 sigma practitioner, able to select and implement tools and techniques in manufacturing operations. Ability to understand and analyze drawings and bill-of-materials. Strong understanding and practical skills in the use of technical information and drawings. Practitioner in process control and quality tools / techniques, gauge R&R etc. and ISO9001 QMS requirements Must be an excellent communicator and provide outstanding leadership. Project management skills, the ability to create and manage a project plan, a plus. Knowledge of relevant industry standards and specifications (ASTM, AWS, EN, ISO etc.) Strong computer skills – MS Excel, Word, Teams email etc. as well as basic CAD skills. Good understanding of manufacturing cost, able to do should cost analysis product cost estimates and throughput modeling. Electric motor manufacturing and controls systems would be an advantage Experience with automated assemblies’ processes would be a benefit. 10 + years of engineering, manufacturing. Multilingual – Spanish / English preferred BS degree in Industrial, mechanical engineering, Mechatronic engineering Needs to hold a passport and documented to travel Globally . Compensation: Competitive, bonus eligible Travel: 30 – 40%, mostly domestic and international Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $80,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Experience level: 10 years Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Weekend availability Work setting: Remote Experience: manufacturing engineering: 10 years (Preferred) Work Location: Remote Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Job Description The Senior GIS Data Engineer and Systems Architect will be responsible for overseeing the design, development, and implementation of GIS data infrastructure, systems architecture, systems integration, and GIS applications specifically focused on transportation-related data. As a Senior GIS Data Engineer and Systems Architect, you will lead a team of work with and mentor a skilled team of GIS personnel, data engineers and architects, working closely with business stakeholders, including city, county, or state DOT and transportation agencies, to ensure that our solutions are AECOM and Client goals. Join a team of experienced technology solution experts to create innovative solutions applying new and emerging technology to transportation. Job Functions include: Develop and implement GIS data management policies and procedures to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and security of our organization's transportation-related GIS data Collaborate with business stakeholders, including city, county, or state DOT and transportation agencies, to understand their transportation-related GIS data needs and develop solutions that meet their requirements Provide technical guidance and expertise to team members, ensuring that they have the necessary resources and tools to complete their work effectively Mentor and develop staff, building a strong team of GIS data engineers and architects Be the technical lead on all transportation-related GIS data projects Manage the development and maintenance of GIS data models, ETL pipelines, and other transportation-related GIS data-related tools and systems Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in the field of transportation-related GIS data engineering and systems architecture and provide recommendations for their implementation within the organization Develop Presentations to internal and external customers. Qualifications Minimum Requirements BA/BS + 6 years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education Preferred Qualifications BA/BS + 8 years of relevant Experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience or education in transportation-related GIS data engineering or systems architecture, with a proven track record of successfully managing complex transportation-related GIS data projects Experienced in ESRI suite of software, including ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGIS Pro, Collector for ArcGIS, Survey 123, Web App Builder Developer, and custom widgets development Strong leadership skills and experience managing a team Ability to mentor and develop staff Background in Python, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, C# and .Net Expertise with ArcGIS, JavaScript API, REST, Angular, dojo, Nodejs, and deployment with IIS. Proficient in databases including SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and other Database Technologies Ability to create, modify, and maintain custom scripts and routines for processes automation and applications Exposure with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP Experience working with city, county, and state DOTs UI/UX design experience Other Software/Tools – Tableau, Power BI, MS Power Apps, Rstudio, Jupyter, Spyder, Ipython Additional Information Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity. We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. Power System Engineer is responsible for coordinating the integration of generation and energy storage resources into the ERCOT System from the initial application for entry into the Generation Interconnection or Change Request (GINR) process to the approval for commercial operations. This responsibility will include performing security screening studies, reviewing and approving Full Interconnection Study (FIS) scope and study reports, review of the Standard Generation Interconnection Agreement (SGIA), review of compliance with ERCOT protocols and market rules, development and approval of modeling data for all phases of the interconnection, support for modeling the generation resource in the Network Model Management System (NMMS) model, Commissioning Plan review and Energization, Synchronization, and Commissioning checklist completion. Essential Job Duties and Tasks: Level 1 Works under the direction of a senior level engineer or supervisor/manager to complete departmental goals and assignments Performs all work according to applicable rules and regulations including regulatory requirements and organization policies and procedures Learns how to use and develop software tools that enhance system reliability and departmental/organizational efficiencies Under direct supervision, participates in teams to obtain input, address comments and perform studies Engineer 2 & 3 Manages the integration of generation and energy storage resources through the entire generation interconnection process from the initial application to the approval for the commercial operations. Ensures that the interconnection of generation and energy storage resources are accomplished in a manner that maintains the reliability of the ERCOT System and complies with the North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) Reliability Standards, ERCOT Protocols, Planning Guide and the Operating Guides. Works closely with Market Participants (MPs), including Interconnecting Entities (IEs), Resource entities (REs), Distribution Service Providers (DSPs), and Transmission Service Providers (TSPs). Works closely with ERCOT System Operations, System Operations Support, Market Operating Services Support, Client Services, System Planning and Metering. Reviews and processes generation interconnection and full interconnection study (FIS) applications. Performs security screening studies to determine first contingency incremental transfer capability for each interconnection request. Attends FIS kickoff meetings, communicates and works with MPs and other ERCOT departments to solve issues related to generation interconnection projects. Reviews and approves Reactive Study reports, FIS scope and reports, and SGIA. Reviews and approves modeling data for all phases of the interconnection process, supports Network Modeling to model the generation resource in the NMMS model. Reviews Commissioning Plan and Energization, Synchronization, and Commissioning checklists. Reviews commissioning testing data, including but not limited to AVR/PSS, and Reactive tests. Develops and maintains tools that automates the studies, reviews, and other processes. Provides training to less experienced engineers. Reviews, drafts, and implements improvements to the interconnection and modeling process Reviews, drafts, and presents: changes to the Protocols, Guides, procedures, training material for other engineers and for MPs, and other supporting ERCOT documents relative to modeling. Senior - Above + Serves as a technical Subject Matter Expert for the department Makes independent decisions except in instances of unusually complex engineering scenarios Works on the most complex engineering issues where analysis of situations requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Has the ability to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways May coordinate, provide presentations and participate in stakeholder meetings with ERCOT personnel, Market Participants and industry Regulatory agencies Fosters and leverages strong working relationships with team and other internal departments Lends professional expertise to guide projects and help teammates assigned by manager Acts as mentor and advisor to less experienced engineers/analysts Leads multifunctional teams to obtain input, address comments and perform studies Demonstrates skills as an expert user of power system software applications and tools, spreadsheet programs, and database programs Maintains knowledge of emerging trends and industry best practices Work Experience Required Engineer 1 No minimum work experience required Engineer 2 Minimum 1 to 2 years (in excess of degree requirements stated above) of progressively responsible experience as a power system engineer or similar type role. Experience within the electric utility industry preferred. Engineer 3 Minimum 3 years (in excess of degree requirements stated above) of progressively responsible experience as a power system engineer or similar type role. Experience within the electric utility industry preferred. Senior Level Engineer Minimum 5 years experience as a power system engineer or similar type role within the electric utility industry Experience within the electric utility industry preferred. Position is open to a level 1, level 2, level 3, or Senior Engineer depending on the candidate's experience that is identified. EDUCATION Bachelor's Degree : Electrical Engineering or related field(s) (Required) or a combination of education and experience that provides equivalent knowledge to a major in such fields is required WORK LOCATION: There are requirements in this role that will be required to be performed on-site. It is estimated that your business area will require this position to be on-site at least (2) days per week at the Taylor location. Circumstances and business needs may require you to be on-site more often. On-site requirements are at the discretion of Management. Remote work schedules shall be performed within Texas. Log-ins during out of state business travel, and any temporary remote work arrangements that have been submitted and approved by HR. It is not an exhaustive list of the duties expected to be performed, and management may, at its discretion, revise or require that other or different tasks be performed as assigned. FY2023 Travis County Benefit Guide In this valuable Travis County Benefits Guide you will find benefit summaries, eligibility requirements, costs, contact numbers and addresses as well as other general information on the benefits available to Travis County Employees and Retirees. Credit Union Employees may join the Travis County Credit Union which offers low-interest loans, savings plans through payroll deduction, safe deposit boxes and other benefits. Deferred Compensation Employees may enroll in a tax- free sheltered investment plan through payroll deduction. Direct Deposit Employees may sign up for direct bank deposit. Employee Assistance Program Travis County provides a confidential counseling and referral service free of charge to county employees and their family. Employee Organizations Membership in the American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees Union is available through payroll deduction. Employee Health & Wellness Clinic Employees may access the clinic for a variety of wellness program and health care services with no co-pay, no deductible and no co-insurance costs. Holidays An average of eleven paid holidays are designated by the Travis County Commissioners Court at the beginning of each fiscal year. Longevity Longevity pay is paid for each year completed after three years of continuous service. Peace Officers in a law enforcement activity, whose job requires state peace officer certification, receive pay after one year of certification. Parking A limited number of assigned parking spaces are available to employees in the Courthouse Complex. Personal Holidays Regular, full-time employees are eligible for up to three paid personal holidays each calendar year. Part-time employees shall be granted personal holidays on a prorated basis. New employees earn personal holidays for the calendar year in which he/she begins employment, based on the month in which employment begins: January – March 3 personal holidays April - June 2 personal holidays July - September 1 personal holiday October - December None New employees are eligible to take personal holidays after 90 days of employment. Retirement Travis County is a member of the Texas County & District Retirement System with mandatory participation by certain classes of employees. Matching of two hundred twenty-five (225%) and a seven percent (7%) of the gross salary is deducted each pay period. An employee is fully vested after eight years of service. Benefits are prorated for part-time employees. Sick Leave Regular employees earn sick leave at a rate of eight hours per month with unlimited accrual during employment. Part-time employees earn sick leave on a pro-rated basis. Parental Leave Each Full-time Paid Parental Leave Eligible (PPL) Employee is entitled to a total of 320 hours of Paid Parental Leave in a 12 month period. Paid Parental Leave for Part-time PPL Eligible Employees is prorated based on the number of hours that they are regularly scheduled to work. Tuition Refund Certain classes of full-time employees may receive reimbursement for fees associated with pre-approved, job related course work completed satisfactorily. Vacation Based on years of county service, regular, full-time employees earn vacation time at the following rates: 0 to 5 years 4.0 hours per pay period 6 to 10 years 4.5 hours per pay period 11 to 15 years 5.0 hours per pay period 16 to 20 years 5.5 hours per pay period 21 plus years 6.0 hours per pay period Part-time employees earn vacation leave on a pro-rated basis. Workers' Compensation The county provides all employees workers' compensation coverage with benefits in accordance with state statute, if the employee sustains an injury out of, or in the course of work.

Responsibilities Analyze functionality of cloud data pipelines and related systems to develop automated tests that validate functional and non-functional requirements, including data validation. Integrate automated testing processes into CICD pipelines. Develop detailed, comprehensive, automated, and well-structured test plans and test cases. Create and execute test plans, including regression testing. Identify and report issues and verify that issues are resolved. Create testing infrastructure and strategy, supporting and controlling all relevant testing procedures. Lead the collaborative design, development and support of the testing infrastructure. Other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications BS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or equivalent professional experience. Proven experience in data/software quality assurance with hands-on experience with automated testing tools. Proven experience in programming in Python, Java, or other programming languages applicable to this context. Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes. Strong experience with relational databases such as Postgres, Oracle, SQL Server, etc. Strong aptitude for troubleshooting and problem solving. Team player, comfortable communicating cross-functionally and across management levels. Self-motivated and able to organize work independently in a rapidly changing environment. Relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate. Preferred Qualifications Experience in test automation in a CI/CD environment. AWS certification. Knowledge of Agile software development methodologies (Kanban, Scrum). Experience with issue tracking systems (JIRA). Salary Range $110,000 + depending on qualifications Working Conditions May work around standard office conditions Repetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation Use of manual dexterity Up to 100% remote at employee discretion with office work environment also an option. Majority of team is located in Austin, TX, and working remotely with infrequent in-office presence.
